ResearchProjectDef.label: amputation
ResearchProjectDef.description: Studying the most effective way to remove a limb in order to prepare it for replacement prosthetics.\nA necessary procedure in order to attach any prostheses.

ResearchProjectDef.label: primitive prosthetics
ResearchProjectDef.description: The most basic of basic prostheses, the absolute bare minimum in pawn mobility.

ResearchProjectDef.label: early functional prosthetics
ResearchProjectDef.description: Whilst still not very useful for mobility, these prostheses allow for limited motor function and hinging of joints.

ResearchProjectDef.label: aesthetic prosthetics
ResearchProjectDef.description: Some pawns can't help but judge scarred and otherwise disfigured colonists, these prostheses will allow you to remove these judgemental thoughts towards the prostheses wearer.

ResearchProjectDef.label: early functional prosthetics
ResearchProjectDef.description: With more understanding of hinge mechanisms, a great deal more motor functions are restored with these prostheses.

ResearchProjectDef.label: early modularisation
ResearchProjectDef.description: Some pawns require specific modules in order to aid in their use of prostheses, these modular implants will allow the user to benefit at the expense of another stat.

ResearchProjectDef.label: electrification of implants
ResearchProjectDef.description: With the utilisation of electricity comes the desire to reduce the workload of various other necessary tasks, prostheses wearing is high on this list.\nDue to the electrification process, wearers of these implants require the need of batteries to draw power from else their implants will seize up.

ResearchProjectDef.label: basic organ transplantation
ResearchProjectDef.description: With the ability to properly store organs, comes the ability to transplant organs.\nThe use of these organs requires the regular use of immunosuppressants or immunoblockers in order to stave off the possibility of organ rejection.

ResearchProjectDef.label: immunosuppressant production
ResearchProjectDef.description: If a pawn has a transplanted organ, they will need to take these, whilst they make pawns more susceptible to disease, they also make sure that the transplanted organs don't experience organ rejection.\nThese pills are not very effective but get the job done. 1 dose is good enough for 5 days.

ResearchProjectDef.label: reparative transplants
ResearchProjectDef.description: Some burns or scars are extremely painful and require constant medication, by removing unscarred tissue from a willing (or unwilling) donor, these scars can be nullified.

ResearchProjectDef.label: advanced organ transplantation
ResearchProjectDef.description: With more research and better medical practices comes a higher likelihood of successful transplantation surgery, these surgeries, whilst riskier, cover organs not commonly transplanted.

ResearchProjectDef.label: early electrical modularisation
ResearchProjectDef.description: The electrified prostheses have shown promise, the idea of modularising these electrified prostheses is a no-brainer. As a bonus, this also allows for the creation of electrified modules for some non-electrified prostheses.

ResearchProjectDef.label: full modularisation
ResearchProjectDef.description: The modularisation of various prostheses has allowed for a great advantage for those that possess them. These implants benefit pawns that have fully electrified prostheses.

ResearchProjectDef.label: specialised modularisation
ResearchProjectDef.description: The inevitable result of being able to customise a prostheses is the desire to specialise the customisation, these implants cover a range of specialisation for even the most creative pawn's desires.

ResearchProjectDef.label: corporeal interaction
ResearchProjectDef.description: The only thing that remained from the current suite of implants and prostheses was the inability for the organic body to meld and control them seamlessly, this process will allow for various sockets that will let the pawn implanted control their prostheses with the same delay as an organic body part.

ResearchProjectDef.label: immunoblocker production
ResearchProjectDef.description: By studying the chemical makeup of immunosuppressants, you will be able to synthesise something stronger.\nPackaged into an inhaler, the immunoblocker will give the same effects as a regular dose of immunosuppressants, albeit 3 times as long. 1 dose is good enough for 15 days.

ResearchProjectDef.label: artificial transplant creation
ResearchProjectDef.description: With some cell samples or the proper materials, your colony will be able to create body parts that are indistinguishable enough from the patient's previous ones. Limbs will essentially be the same as organic ones, organs no longer require regular doses of immunosuppressants and skin grafts allow your prisoners to keep the skin on their arses.

ResearchProjectDef.label: artificial skin grafts
ResearchProjectDef.description: With some cell samples and proper materials, your part printer will be capable of making an elastic material almost the exact same as a pawn's natural skin, making skin grafts less resource intensive or more moral, depending on your prior source of skin.

ResearchProjectDef.label: artificial limbs
ResearchProjectDef.description: With some cell samples and proper materials, your part printer will be able to make a limb almost indistinguishable from your pawn's natural ones, they will function in the exact same way as a natural one.

ResearchProjectDef.label: artificial organs
ResearchProjectDef.description: With some cell samples and proper materials, your part printer will be able to make a variety of organs that function almost indistinguishably from your pawn's natural ones, due to these organs being created using cells, these organs will not experience organ rejection, pretty neat huh?

ResearchProjectDef.label: early mechanical limbs
ResearchProjectDef.description: With the creation of the limb connector, the ability to power prostheses from natural metabolic processes has proven to be possible, by attaching these prototype mechanical prostheses, your pawns will no longer need to connect to batteries in order to recharge them, at a cost of needing to sleep more.

ResearchProjectDef.label: early mechanical organs
ResearchProjectDef.description: Whilst the limb connectors aren't possible to connect organs, the same design principle can be refitted in order to work with these organ prototypes. The user of these implants will feel more tired due to the metabolic processes powering these organs but will experience increased capabilities from the get go as well as no longer needing a regimen of immunosuppressants.

ResearchProjectDef.label: mechanical modularisation experimentation
ResearchProjectDef.description: The mechanical prostheses have their own ups and downs, but just like the electrified prostheses, these peaks and valleys can be smoothed out one way or another. These modules can conveniently also apply to electrified prostheses.

ResearchProjectDef.label: fully realised mechanisation
ResearchProjectDef.description: After extensive tinkering with the mechanical limbs, the new line of prostheses are better in almost every way. More efficient, better for your pawns' nightlife and with more modularisation opportunities for the discerning user.

ResearchProjectDef.label: fully mechanical organs
ResearchProjectDef.description: After extensive tinkering with the mechanical organs, the new line of prostheses are better in almost every way. The surgeries have become almost non-invasive, for some they're a simple pill, otherwise the efficiency and ability for pawns to stay up past sundown are enough of an upgrade.

ResearchProjectDef.label: aesthetic skin grafts
ResearchProjectDef.description: By interlacing various precious metal threads with the artificial skin material, your part printer is capable of creating aesthetically beautiful skin to replace a pawn's own.

ResearchProjectDef.label: armoured skin grafts
ResearchProjectDef.description: By interlacing threads made from various materials with the artificial skin material, your part printer is capable of creating light but tough subdermal armours that will replace a pawn's natural skin.

ResearchProjectDef.label: advanced modularisation capabilities
ResearchProjectDef.description: Further advances in technology miniaturisation will allow your colony to create better modules for mechanical prostheses, these modules are only able to be implemented on early and advanced mechanical prostheses.

ResearchProjectDef.label: specialised mechanical modularisation
ResearchProjectDef.description: For when your pawns really need to specialise in a skill, these modules will give a ridiculous level of expertise and capabilities for the skill set they're associated with.\nJust... don't ask them to something that's out of that skill set.

ResearchProjectDef.label: shimmerskin
ResearchProjectDef.description: By interlacing some threads made using extremely rare materials with the artificial skin material, your part printer is capable of producing Shimmerskin, a beautiful implant that not only beautifies its user, but also allows for a small amount of light to follow them.\nSome users of Shimmerskin have reported the faint light causing problems with sleeping.
